pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.16: For the further development of these events, see Kd 11:25.1.1–31.1.219.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.56: The Pali text just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
